references.paper_title: 3d gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper introduces 3D Gaussian Splatting (3D-GS), the core technology used in the submitted work for representing and rendering scenes.
This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), crucial for generating precise masks used for feature extraction and semantic understanding in the 3D-GS representation.

references.paper_title: Nerf: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), an early core concept for representing 3D scenes used as basis for more complicated methods.

references.paper_title: Hypernerf: A higher-dimensional representation for topologically varying neural radiance fields
references.reason: This paper presents a method based on NeRFs for modelling topologically varying neural radiance fields, used for experiments in the submitted work.
This paper introduces LangSplat, a language-driven method based on 3D-GS that represents a baseline, of which the submitted work is an extension to dynamic scenes.
